title: Linear and rotational motion - string on axle

content.question: A horizontal disk has an axle of radius <math alttext="r " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> at its center, as shown. A string is wound around the axle and pulled at a constant speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math>, causing the disk to rotate with angular speed <math alttext="omega" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>ω</mi></mstyle></math>. The string does not slip on the axle. If the axle is replaced with an axle with a radius larger than <math alttext="r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math>, with what speed will the string need to be pulled so that the disk again rotates with angular speed <math alttext="omega" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>ω</mi></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: It cannot be determined without knowing the relative radii of the axles and the disk
